duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide overall human resources support for the Food Operations Management in Theme Park with emphasis on conducting investigations and provide resolutions of concerns related to employee complaints, misconduct, and performance.
Provide HR counsel to Management Team on employee relations issues as well as investigating and responding to complaints and complex, high-risk, or sensitive employee relations cases.
Ensure fair and consistent enforcement of policies and practices. Investigate employee workplace situations including claims of harassment, discrimination, and policy violations.
Lead key HR processes for client groups (salary planning/reward management, performance management and goal setting, succession planning, employee satisfaction survey/TSAT, 360 feedback, etc).
Partner with Labor Relations to ensure compliance with collective bargaining agreements and to assist in resolving grievances.

Provide support to client groups by interacting and communicating with employees in the park, visiting break rooms, and Lead offices to promote positive relations and seek out/resolve potential issues.

Act as a liaison between clients and core staff functions by assisting with rolling out new Company initiatives and communicating information relating to career development, recognition programs, payroll, benefits, training, and staffing.
Mentor and provide guidance to professional staff related to their career goals. Build bench strength within the departments by identifying training and development opportunities.
Proactively manage HR systems to ensure data integrity. Partner with HRIS on resolving system issues. Partner with Timekeeper on payroll problems and resolutions.
Ensure compliance with Federal, State, and local laws.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Industrial Relations, Business Management or related field required (advanced degree preferred)
